'''James Anthony Traficant, Jr.''' (born May 8, 1941) is a former [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] in the [[United States Congress]] from [[Ohio]] (from 1985 to 2002). He was [[Expulsion from the United States Congress|expelled]] after being convicted of taking bribes, filing false tax returns, [[racketeering]], and forcing his aides to perform chores at his farm in Ohio and on his houseboat in [[Washington, D.C.]],<ref name="cnn">{{cite web | url = http://archives.cnn.com/2002/LAW/04/11/traficant.trial/ | title = Archives | publisher = CNN.com | accessdate = 2007-11-12}}</ref> and was released from prison on September 2, 2009, after serving an eight-year sentence.<ref name="prison">{{cite web | url = http://www.bop.gov/iloc2/InmateFinderServlet?Transaction=NameSearch&needingMoreList=false&LastName=traficant&Middle=&FirstName=james&Race=U&Sex=U&Age=&x=0&y=0 | title = Inmate Finder | publisher = Bureau of Prisons Web site| accessdate = 2007-11-12}}</ref>
+
'''James Anthony Traficant, Jr.''' (born May 8, 1941) is a former [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] [[United States House of Representatives|Representative]] in the [[United States Congress]] from [[Ohio]] (from 1985 to 2002). He was [[Expulsion from the United States Congress|expelled]] after being convicted of taking bribes, filing false tax returns, [[racketeering]], and forcing his aides to perform chores at his farm in Ohio and on his houseboat in [[Washington, D.C.]],<ref name="cnn">{{cite web | url = http://archives.cnn.com/2002/LAW/04/11/traficant.trial/ | title = Archives | publisher = CNN.com | accessdate = 2007-11-12}}</ref> and was released from prison on September 2, 2009, after serving an seven-year sentence.<ref name="prison">{{cite web | url = http://www.bop.gov/iloc2/InmateFinderServlet?Transaction=NameSearch&needingMoreList=false&LastName=traficant&Middle=&FirstName=james&Race=U&Sex=U&Age=&x=0&y=0 | title = Inmate Finder | publisher = Bureau of Prisons Web site| accessdate = 2007-11-12}}</ref>
Traficant's wife, Tish, has reportedly stated<ref>http://www.vindy.com/news/2008/dec/14/traficant-may-forgo-cca-house-friend-says/ Traficant won't go to halfway house (December 14, 2008).</ref> that he did not accept the DOJ's invitation to be supervised on early release by Richard J. Billak (the CEO of CCA). Billak had testified against him during Traficant's 2002 Federal Bribery trial.<ref>http://www.fox8.com/news/wjw-news-traficant-promotion,0,610757.story</ref><ref>http://ethics.house.gov/Investigations/Default.aspx?Section=37 Trial Transcript, March 4/5, 2002.</ref>
Traficant's wife, Tish, has reportedly stated<ref>http://www.vindy.com/news/2008/dec/14/traficant-may-forgo-cca-house-friend-says/ Traficant won't go to halfway house (December 14, 2008).</ref> that he did not accept the DOJ's invitation to be supervised on early release by Richard J. Billak (the CEO of CCA). Billak had testified against him during Traficant's 2002 Federal Bribery trial.<ref>http://www.fox8.com/news/wjw-news-traficant-promotion,0,610757.story</ref><ref>http://ethics.house.gov/Investigations/Default.aspx?Section=37 Trial Transcript, March 4/5, 2002.</ref>
